metadata.title: CVE-2012-3519 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
routerlist.c in Tor before 0.2.2.38 uses a different amount of time forrelay-list iteration depending on which relay is chosen, which might allowremote attackers to obtain sensitive information about relay selection viaa timing side-channel attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3519` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tor - 0.2.3.22-rc-1
tor-geoipdb - 0.2.3.22-rc-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tor package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.2.3.22-rc-1').
